title: Southwest Chicken Grain Bowl
description: A vibrant, protein-packed bowl featuring spiced grilled chicken, smoky black beans, roasted corn, and a zesty lime-cilantro dressing over a warm farro and brown rice blend. Bright, tangy, and slightly smoky flavors with crisp vegetables make this an easy weeknight meal or meal-prep favorite.

ingredients.notes: cut into 1/2-inch strips or bite-sized pieces
or 1 cup farro + 1 cup brown rice for a larger batch; cook per package

ingredients.display_name: black beans (cooked or canned, drained and rinsed)

ingredients.notes: if frozen, thaw; if fresh, cut from 1-2 ears
juice for dressing and garnish; zest optional
divided between marinade, cooking, and dressing
used in lime-cilantro dressing for creaminess

ingredients.display_name: optional hot sauce or diced jalapeño

steps.text: Prepare the grain base: rinse the farro/brown rice blend, then combine with water in a saucepan using package ratio (about 2 cups water per 1 cup dry blend). Bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer, cover and cook until tender, about 25 minutes; drain any excess and keep warm.

While grains cook, make the chicken marinade: in a bowl combine olive oil, lime juice, minced garlic, cumin, chili powder, smoked paprika, half the salt and pepper. Add chicken pieces and toss to coat; let marinate briefly while preheating the pan (at least 5 minutes).

Cook the chicken: heat a large skillet or grill pan over medium-high heat with a drizzle of oil. Add marinated chicken in a single layer and cook without moving until seared, about 3-4 minutes per side, until internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C). Remove and rest 3 minutes, then slice if needed.

Sauté the vegetables and beans: in the same skillet add a touch more oil, cook corn and diced red pepper over medium-high heat until lightly charred, about 4-5 minutes. Add black beans and sliced red onion, warm through 1-2 minutes, seasoning with remaining salt and pepper. Remove from heat.

Prepare the lime-cilantro dressing: whisk together Greek yogurt, remaining lime juice and zest, chopped cilantro, a tablespoon of olive oil, minced garlic, and optional hot sauce or jalapeño; adjust salt and pepper to taste.

Assemble the bowls: divide warm grains among bowls, top with cooked chicken, sautéed corn-black bean mixture, sliced avocado if using, and spoon the lime-cilantro dressing over each. Garnish with extra cilantro and lime wedges and serve immediately.
